tool.name: Simulate muon experiment spin dynamics (muspinsim)
tool.command: pip install git+https://github.com/muon-spectroscopy-computational-project/muspinsim.git && ln -s $mu_sim $mu_sim.name && ln -s $mu_exp_in $mu_exp_in.name && ## grab 'name' field from input file, if it doesn't exist, set name as 'muspinsim' mu_out=\$(grep -A1 '^name' $mu_sim.name | grep -v 'name' | sed -e 's/^[ \t]*//') && mu_out=\${mu_out:-"muspinsim"}.dat && log_out=\$(echo $mu_sim.name | cut -d '.' -f1).log && ## if fitting data required, change filepath in input file to point to symlink if grep '^fitting_data' $mu_sim; then sed -iE "/^fitting_data/{n;s/([^)]*)/(\"$mu_exp_in.name\")/g}" $mu_sim.name; fi && muspinsim $mu_sim.name && mv \$mu_out mu_out.dat && mv \$log_out log_out.log

param.name: mu_exp_in
param.label: Experiment data to fit (.dat) (Optional)
param.help: Only required if the 'fitting_data' parameter is set in the configuration file above.

tool.help:
MuSpinSim is a program designed to carry out spin dynamics calculations
Tool requires an input (.in) file which describes system and experiment details This is a text file containing keywords and values in indented blocks.
https://muon-spectroscopy-computational-project.github.io/muspinsim/
Command-line usage: muspinsim muspinsim.in
